title: Nanomaterials - An Introduction to Synthesis, Properties and App
description:
Nanomaterials - An Introduction to Synthesis, Properties and Applications 2nd ed - Dieter Vollath (Wiley-VCH, 2013).pdf

ISBN 978-3-527-33379-0

Successor of the highly acclaimed, first fullâ€“color introduction to nanomaterials â€“ now including graphenes and carbon nanotubes

This fullâ€“colored introduction to nanomaterials and nanotechnology in particular addresses the needs of engineers who need to know the special phenomena and potentials, without getting bogged down in the scientific detail of the physics and chemistry involved.

Based on the authorâ€²s own courses, this textbook shows how to produce nanomaterials and use them in engineering applications for novel products. Following an introduction, the text goes on to treat synthesis, characterization techniques, thermal, optical, magnetic and electronic properties, processing and, finally, emerging applications.

A sound overview of the "nano world" from an applicationâ€“oriented perspective.

Reviews for the first edition:

"The reader [of this book] profits from the broad scientific teaching experience of the author.... This book is highly recommended for everyone who wants to step onto the new and fascinating field of nanomaterials." (International Journal of Materials Research, May 2009)

"The practical presentation and clarity in writing style makes this book a winner for anyone wanting to quickly learn about the fundamentals and practical side of nanomaterials." (IEEE Electrical Insulation Magazine, March/April 2009)
